pros: Love the work, but coworkers make or break a job and here it is definitely broken. :-(
cons: It's not what it used to be. I'm a rehire, and like all the other low starred reviews the environment and coworkers are toxic. It's such a shame because it doesn't have to be that way! Money means nothing if you can't enjoy your environment, or feel like a team when working as a team is critical, but un-achievable, and when you want to work here to make a difference- but can't because it's impossible with the rude culture of some areas of this organization. Poor communication, lots of staff hate training and they make people feel bad for asking questions or making mistakes. It's not the place I remember.

review_title: What is the worth of feeling valued?

review_title: Most supportive environment I've ever worked in

pros:
wide range of experience opportunities.
Teaching hospital so lots of support for new hires or people moving into new positions.
company is involved in the community and has many different branches and locations.
cons: not great compensation, no bonus's, have to use your own earn time for holiday's the organization is closed, poor management in many areas, reports of staff bullying, "toxic" work environments that are swept under the rug by management.

review_title: Opportunities to Learn, but Worst Management Ever
pros: There are opportunities to Learn if you can learn on your own without any training.
cons:
While working here, I've had three benefits that were taken from me after being hired:

- Health plan related benefits like being able to see a specialist without a referral from my PCP. The plans says I can, but in reality it's no allowed.

- Earned Time has been retroactively taken from all employees more than once.

- Remote Working (from home) is no longer allowed even for people who negotiated it prior to being hired.

The managers don't meet with employees. It's the worst communication I've ever witnessed. When someone leaves, they don't even try to counter the offer, no matter how important the employee is.

review_title: Great level of autonomy, no micromanagement, lovely patients and coworkers

Poor communication/ lack of consistency from management. On-call every 3-5 weeks and usually scheduled to see 4-6 patients on both Sat. and Sun, in addition to being on-call for 48 hours straight, then being expected to work normal shift on Monday.

review_title: Don't let MaineGeneral Suck You In!
pros: Patients are wonderful to serve. Great facility! Super Technology! Lovely cafeteria with great food. Some really nice people are in the front lines.
cons: Senior Management says they're interested in you as an employee. But really, they don't care. Then, when at-least one of their administrative directors are allowed to bully and perpetuate a hostile work environment, it's the wild-west when human resources is involved. What they are allowed to do because of the unwritten rule is horrible. Please, if you can avoid it, please don't work at MaineGeneral. People are treated as objects, and not as people. I felt sick on a daily basis to come to work there. I finally left because I was treated poorly and not at all valued or respected by my direct manager. And their behavior was and is allowed to persist, despite formal complaints. Pay is barely enough and benefits stink. It's not worth it.

review_title: Nice people. Nurse managers too indecisive
pros: New hospital. Clean building. OK pay.
cons: 12-hour shifts. Nurse managers are too slow to fill vacancies. Other employees suffer due to slow hiring process.

pros: I loved it here at MGMC.  As a moderate sized community hospital, I feel as if the care we provided was exceptional! Did it pay the best, no, were benefits stellar, no, But I've got to say, that hospital had the best darn group of physicians and nurses that I've ever had the pleasure of working with . We're we short-staffed? Sure, who isn't, but you always could count on your team to have your back...  I miss my team at MGMC!
cons: Benefits could be better!  The staff segregation for parking is a bit silly...  I bought into the 'green parking' until I saw all the docs and their luxury SUV's parking out in the 'green' lot.

pros: The reason I accepted my position is because of the RESPECT Values and Standards.  And also because my Supervisor is so easy to work with.  Expectations are high, but achievable.  It was so easy to align with these expectations and to see them carried out by this tremendous workforce each and every day.
cons: Being a Community Hospital it is often difficult to compete with the larger HealthCare organizations.  However, being smaller makes it easier to be nimble and flexible in ways that employees appreciate.

review_title: Excellent! Other than Management needs better communication towards their employees.
pros: Fast paced environment. The work is consistent and you’re constantly busy which is good. Housekeeping does great with team work! Always learning something new.
cons: Working an every other weekend & every other holiday  job is hard to maintain with a 1 year old. The pay isn’t the greatest, not for where I’m at right now in life I need more to provide for my daughter and I. Also, I felt that there was poor communication between my shift leaders and supervisor. Nobody was ever on the same page.

review_title: Excellent Company, Terrific People, Great Opportunities!!
pros: I have been with this company for nearly a decade, and after spending many years prior in other healthcare firms in the area this one was - and still is - one of the very best healthcare employers in the Central Maine region (and arguably, the entire State!). The organization spends a great deal of time and resources on doing what it takes to be the premier provider of healthcare to the community, as evidenced by the major investment a few years ago in building a state of the art hospital, opening earlier than planned.  Senior management is exceptional at listening to staff's ideas and incorporating them when feasible. I feel valued as an employee and appreciate that level of support.  The recent outstanding Joint Commission audit is another positive example of the positive trajectory this organization is on!  I have changed jobs internally three times since coming to MaineGeneral (each one involving more responsibility).  Because I believe in professional growth and have worked hard to improve my skills and knowledge I have been afforded opportunity to grow with the organization. Anyone here can do the same thing with some personal drive and determination to better themselves.
cons: Every business has pros and cons, but MaineGeneral does not have any cons in my opinion that rise to the level of a major concern.

pros:
Great teams that work together.  Excellent patients care.  Amazing work environment.  Outstanding cafeteria and food. Opportunities to grow.  Professional development support.  Process improvement initiatives with positive outcomes and expanded training for staff in any job role.  
Great clinical care teams that focus on quality, safety and involving staff in decision making.
cons: Not a Trauma center.  The organization is a little smaller than the other hospitals in Maine which can be nice but also can limit your opportunities.

review_title: Nepotism is rampant in kennebec valley
pros: Very small hospital, intimate environment.
cons: There is no real privacy. Everyone knows everyone,so if you have something done, someone inside the hospital will gossip.Forget about professionalism either.since the people who have higher positions such as supervisor or manager got to their position by never leaving the area, not because they are actually good at what they do.

review_title: The company does not care one iota about its employees.
pros: Pay is average. My particular unit's manager & staff is amazing & friendly. Time off is fair. There are always openings, so its easy to get into.
cons: Insurance is terrible, decisions are arbitrary, staff turnover is high. When asking other departments about job openings, no one ever gets back to you.

pros: A great culture of respect and empathy, you really are in control of your own development/advancement. There are a lot of opportunities, from tuition reimbursement to an education committee to grow and stay here.
cons: If I had to think of one, the health benefits are costly - but the organization absorbs so much of the cost and there is a generous employee discount for MGH services, plus a lot of the other benefits (time off, wellness, pet insurance) that are great.

review_title: When ever someone tells me they applied for a job here, I tell them to run.
pros: Decent health insurance, but that's about it. They gave us a holiday dinner every year and I felt that that was pretty considerate.
cons: Basically with Maine General, all they care about is the all mighty dollar.  When I was there, we never got a Christmas bonus and ON TOP of that, they and the nerve to ask us (i made close to minimum wage) to donate part of our paycheck to help build the new multi million dollar hospital.  Vacation time is not very good either.

pros:
-Positive, supportive, exceptional managers.
-New, LEED certified hospital.
-professional growth is encouraged and rewarded.
cons:
-RN ratios sometimes inappropriate, decreasing job satisfaction
-The hospital uses Vocera, which are an excellent communication tool, but perhaps overuses them for monitor alarms, bed alarms, chair alarms, etc, which at times creates alarm fatigue and communication dysfunction.

review_title: New hospital debt servicing forces benefits and pay to be below average
pros: The patient and cafeteria food is excellent for a hospital.
cons:
Employee health insurance has very high deductible, very high cost from paycheck and high annual out of pocket cap. 
     A tremendous amount of middle management that are absent from their offices a lot because they are forced to attend many unnecessary meetings.

pros: My co workers are wonderful and I like my job except for the pay.
cons: The pay sucks. When Secretary's are coming in at more money then I make and I am a Certified Medical Assistant with a lot of responsibility and further education. Been doing this for 9 years. What a slap in the face for us.

review_title: Not a great place to work.
pros: Education-- take all the classes & get all the certifications you can and then run, because you won't get paid for your experience & knowledge there.
cons: Pay sucks. Benefits suck. Management sucks. You are not supported as an employee here. It's like working for the popular clique in high school. Don't get involved with the politics. Don't get conned into join a committee, your opinions are not valued, and they'd rather not hear them anyway. Seriously, anywhere is better than MaineGen.

review_title: Very good place to learn what you need to know.

review_title: MaineGeneral is a great place to work!
